original_text: Spanish Language version - Medicamentos Gen√©ricos: Preguntas y Respuestas (PDF - 213 KB) What are generic drugs? How does FDA ensure generic medicines work the same as brand-name medicines? Why does a...

qa_pairs.output: Generic medicines are duplicates of existing brand-name drugs, manufactured to have the same dosage, form, safety, efficacy, strength, administration route, quality, performance, and intended use as their branded counterparts.

qa_pairs.text_input: How does the FDA guarantee the efficacy of generic medicines?
qa_pairs.output: The FDA conducts rigorous evaluations to ensure that generic medicines meet the same standards as brand-name counterparts in terms of dosage, form, safety, efficacy, strength, and labeling, and they undergo inspections of manufacturing facilities and ongoing monitoring of drug safety post-approval.

qa_pairs.text_input: What accounts for the cost difference between generic and brand-name medicines?
qa_pairs.output: Generic medicines incur lower production costs because they don't have to undergo the same extensive research and clinical trials as brand-name drugs, leading to substantial price reductions (typically 80-85%) compared to their branded counterparts.
